title: 29 hospitalised after three-bus collision in Galle
byline: At least 29 passengers were injured after three buses collided at the Imaduwa-Angulugaha junction in Galle this morning.

title: Over Rs. 207 M  in fines imposed for consumer violations
byline: The Consumer Affairs Authority conducted 24,761 raids in 2024, resulting in 23,953 cases being filed.

title: Australian PM recognises new citizens including those from Sri Lanka
byline: Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese recognised Australia’s new citizens including those from Sri Lanka, as Australia celebrated Australia Day on Sunday.

title: Government to fill 30,000 vacancies within public service
byline: The government is planning to fill approximately 30,000 existing vacancies within the public service and to allocate necessary funds in the upcoming budget.

title: Kamindu Mendis crowned as ICC Men’s Emerging Cricketer of the Year
byline: Kamindu Mendis, who shone for Sri Lanka with consistent batting displays in the year gone by, has been named as the ICC Men’s Emerging Cricketer of the Year.

title: Three-wheeler driver arrested for selling two Ella Odyssey e-tickets for Rs. 28,000
byline: A three-wheeler driver was arrested by the Kandy Divisional Crime Investigation Unit for selling Rs. 4,000 worth two e-tickets of the Ella Odyssey train to two British women for Rs. 28,000.

title: Haliela woman’s kidnappers arrested
byline: A group of men, including an apparel factory worker, was arrested for abducting a 21-year-old woman attending a nurses’ training course at the Sri Lanka Foreign Employment Bureau (SLFEB) branch at Haliela.

title: Navy seizes 03 Indian fishing boats poaching in Sri Lankan waters north of Mannar
byline: The Sri Lanka Navy and Coast Guard seized three Indian fishing boats and arrested 33 Indian fishermen while they were poaching in Sri Lankan waters, during special operations conducted in the sea area north of Mannar on 25 and 26 January.

title: Grade 5 exam score reflects collapse of primary education: Stalin
byline: Even after awarding free marks for three answers, the minimum score in the recent Grade Five scholarship examination results has dropped by ten points, reflecting the collapse of primary education in Sri Lanka, Ceylon Teachers’ Union (CTU) General Secretary, Joseph Stalin said.

title: Mediation Board says hang the dog and send a photo
byline: The Animal Welfare Coalition (AWC) today claimed that a mediation board in Oddusuddan in Mullaitivu District has issued a verdict to hang a dog which had bit a goat, in order to resolve a conflict between two groups of people.

title: Police clarify why Yoshitha Rajapaksa wasn’t handcuffed
byline: In response to criticism regarding why former President Mahinda Rajapaksa’s son Yoshitha Rajapaksa was not handcuffed during his arrest, the police clarified that it is not necessary to handcuff every suspect who is arrested.

title: Four inmates injured in clash at Galle Prison
byline: At least four inmates were injured following a clash which broke out between two groups of inmates at the Galle Prison this afternoon (26).
